{{BLP sources|date=May 2010}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Meli'sa Morgan | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | origin = | genre = [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], [[House music|house]] | occupation = | years_active = | label = [[Capitol Records|Capitol]], Pendulum, [[Orpheus Records|Orpheus]] | associated_acts = Shades of Love, High Fashion | website = http://www.melisamorgan.com }} '''Meli'sa Morgan''' is an [[African American]] [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] [[singing|singer]] born in [[Queens]], [[New York City|New York]] who had a string of [[urban contemporary]] and [[house music]] [[hit record|hits]] in the 1980s and 1990s. She got her start in the [[music industry]] whilst singing with a church [[gospel]] [[choir]] called the Starlets of Corona. She cites [[Chaka Khan]] as a major influence. ==Early successes== Her initial chart entry was as the lead singer of the [[dance music|dance]] [[musical ensemble|group]], [[Shades of Love]]. They had a single entry on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[magazine]]'s [[Hot Dance Club Play]] [[record chart|chart]] in 1982, the #26 "Body to Body (Keep in Touch)". This was re-popularized in 1994 by new [[remix]]es, "Body to Body (Keep in Touch)", and reached [[chart-topper|number 1]] on the Hot Dance Club Play chart. That same year, music entrepreneur [[Jacques Fred Petrus]] asked her to join his newly created studio group, High Fashion, that featured Morgan and two other New York vocalists, Eric McClinton and [[Alyson Williams]]. High Fashion's sole hit, "Feelin' Lucky Lately", reached #32 on the [[United States|U.S.]] [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs|Black Singles]] chart. In 1983 Morgan left, and was replaced in the group by the [[jazz]] vocalist, Marcella Allen. As a [[solo (music)|solo]] [[musician|artist]] she topped the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs|R&B]] chart with her [[cover version]] of [[Prince (artist)|Prince]]'s "Do Me, Baby",{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p4956|pure_url=yes}}|title=Biography: Meli'sa Morgan|last=Wynn|first=Ron|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|accessdate=30 May 2010}} (the title track from her debut [[album]]) which also became her only [[Billboard Hot 100]] entry, peaking at #46 in 1986. She had several solo hits on the U.S. dance chart as well, including "Still in Love With You," which hit #3 in 1992. ==2005 to present== After a lengthy hiatus, Morgan released her fifth solo album, ''I Remember''. The first single, "Back Together Again", a song originally recorded by [[Roberta Flack]] and [[Donny Hathaway]], received moderate airplay on [[urban contemporary]] [[radio station]]s during early 2006 and peaked at number 46 on Billboard's R&B chart. The follow-up singles included "I Remember", "Will You?" and "High Maintenance" which was released in September 2006. New material by Meli'sa Morgan can be heard on a German release by Cool Million, which features Meli'sa Morgan on lead vocals on the opening track Sweet Baby. This proves she is still vocally on top condition. ==Influence== A verse from Morgan's 1986 single "Fool's Paradise" was re-sung, with modified lyrics, by [[Mary J.
